column1: #Text=[0005] In this type of construction, the tub cannot directly touch the floor, since the tub moves during the machine operation.
#Text=Thus, a need exists to provide a suspension system which is able to absorb or dissipate at least part of the vibratory energy transmitted to the tub.
#Text=[0006] A known solution to overcome this problem usually includes a cabinet surrounding both the tub and the motor unit and which is positioned directly on the floor.
#Text=This arrangement also includes a suspension system generally in the form of springs or other elastic elements that are secured, at one end, to the tub and at the other end, to the cabinet.
#Text=[0007] This solution requires a cabinet to operate as a support structure for the washing machine and also as an aesthetic housing.

#Text=In addition to increasing the number of components needed to assemble the washing machine, the cabinet increases the space required for the washing machine, since it must internally accommodate the suspension system, while providing a gap between the tub and the cabinet.
#Text=This gap must be sufficient to prevent the tub from colliding with the cabinet during spinning operations with an unbalanced load of clothes.
#Text=[0008] Another known solution is described in the patent document PCT/AU97/00334.
#Text=In this solution, the motor unit is attached at one end to the vertical drive shaft that passes through the bottom of the tub and at an opposite end to the support frame.
#Text=The support frame is secured to a base structure that is suspended by a suspension system.
#Text=In this solution, the tub is attached to the support frame and vibrates with the basket and motor unit during machine operation.
#Text=The suspension system is provided under the support frame, allowing the height of the cabinet to be limited to the height of the support frame.

#Text=However, this solution still requires a cabinet with sufficient height to surround the whole tub, in order to visually and operationally protect the tub during machine operation, since the tub vibrates concurrently with the basket and the motor unit.
